intro: Bursinopetalum arboreum, commonly known as the tree hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink and purple. The plant has a woody stem and broad, palmate leaves that are often used in traditional medicine. It thrives in warm, humid climates and requires well-drained soil to flourish. Bursinopetalum arboreum is often cultivated for its ornamental value and ecological benefits.
